intro: Fumaria numidica, commonly known as the Numidian glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. Fumaria numidica is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
